text:
330ml bottle ([email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */s)
Lovely raisiny aroma. Full smooth palate. Good roasty taste, nice wooliness. Strangely thin for its strength, but thats not a negative. Lacks the complexity of other ola dubhs, perhaps. Alcohol barely restrained.

(Aged for I think 4 years) black hue with a thin light tan head that recedes to a gentle spotty cap. Lovely deep roasty woody aroma with gentle peat and a kiss of sweet smokey malt tones with a whisper of plum. Brisk flavor that features subtle scotch notes of peat and woody leather tones but is backed up by some warm and smoothly sweet dark English old ale maltiness with a little plum and fig, and a woody gentle scotch-like finish. Really pleasant, not too warm, not too scotch-y, mellow and smooth and sweet and dark and toasty.

Bottle from a friend. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, nuts, peat, smoke and licorice. Bitter finish with roasted malts, licorice, smoke, peat, smoke, chocolate and nuts. Exquisite brew.

Bottle from systembolaget, cellared for a couple of years. Pitch black with almost no head. Oily texture. Boozy, peated aroma with molasses and oak. Peat is a little bit overpowering. Taste is similar with roast, earth, molasses, soy sauce and salt. No smokiness at all in the taste which is a big plus for me. Slightly bitter chocolate finish.
chocolate, toast, caramel, black, hazy, minimal head, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, bitter, whiskey fudge taste.

Shared bottle. Pour is dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, and alcohol. Taste is roasted malt, soy sauce, alcohol, licorice, chocolate, and wood. Oily with a heavy body. Pretty good stuff.

Aroma: lots of soy sauce and molasses; Appearance: pitch black with creamy tan head; Taste: smoky and fruity; very complex and malty; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet finish and an odd aftertaste that I cant quite place; Overall: delicious; would definitely get again.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Black with a small, beige head. 
Rather light, roasted aroma with notes of oak. 
Surprisingly lit body. 
Dry oak and whiskey in the flavour.

Bottle at Hopyard, november 13th 2015. Black body with a tiny brown head. Aroma of toffee, tobaccoo, wood and smoke. Taste is strong black licorice and coffee, with a sweet toffee and whisky presence, burned, leather, pleasant roast and peat finish. Excellent malty fullbodied aftertaste. Very nice.
33 cl bottle from systembolaget. 2013 edition. Pours black with little head. Smokey whisky aroma with sweet smokey liquorice and caramel.
Bottle..Pour is black with a tan head..Nose is chocolate, roast, spice, dusty, heavy barrel..Taste is barrel, spice, musty, oak, smoky..

Black pour with surprisingly decent one finger brown head. Indistinguishable in appearance from the others sampled at the same time. All had the same basic notes of licorice, tar, tabacco, and leather. This one was significantly hotter and more abrasive than the others. Very smokey earthy finish, and kinda like licking a stick of wood. It was like someone just poured whisky into my beer. Definitely not that great a beer imo.

Negra, turva, espuma marrom de pouca formação e média persistência. Aroma defumado, amadeirado, cacau, chocolate, licor, pudim de doce de leite, alcoólica, complexa. Paladar caramelado, adocicado médio/intenso, baixo amargor residual torrado. Aftertaste intenso e duradouro, amadeira, defumada, adocicada. Uma das melhores que já bebi.

Aroma: malt, sea air, iodine and caramel
App: black with no head
Flavour: big whiskey smoke and rich carbonised malt
Palate: warming whiskey finish with lingering iodine and malt

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The beer pours thick and black body with a thin, quickly dissipating milk chocolate colored head. The beer has a mild alcohol aroma along with some vanilla, oak, leather, dark chocolate,and some smokiness. The beer has a nice smokiness up front with plenty of flavor from the oak. I get some vanilla and dark chocolate notes. I do get some alcohol in the flavor, but its not strong. Some dark fruits come out more as the beer warms. Dry earthiness, leather in the finish. The body is medium with low carbonation. The beer goes down smoothly for such a big beer. This is an excellent beer.

15.05.2015, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Small light brown bubbly mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich, dark malts, dark sugar, leather, minerals, caramel, licorice, vanilla, butterscotch, oak, grass, hints of peat. Taste is slightly dry mineraly, dark malts, licorice, hay, oak, leather, minerals, whisky, grass, caramel, salt water, hints of peat. Medium bitterness, slightly watery mouthfeel. Nice enough.

Bottle boxing bottle share may v pac. Black ok tan head. Aroma is dark fruits mollasses good oaky whiskey notes taste same nice vanilla good smokey whiskey really nice sweetness throughout nice long bitter finish. Good oily mouthfeel. Very good this much sweeter than other olah I have tried. Very good.

May for pac boxing night. Bottle shared with Richthevillan and s_hartshorne. Black beer with small head. Aroma dark malts and some little whisky. Taste is light whisky, dark malts and treacle. Medium bodied, oily. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Mayweather v Pacquiao bottle share night with Sarkynorthener & s_hartshorne; dark brown pour with a thin tan head, smoke and roast malt aroma, taste has sweet chocolate, some phenols, quite boozy and meaty,

(Harviestoun Ola Dubh 1991) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 10.5%
Black coloured body, small dark brown head, with average retention, leaving light laing behind.
Sweet aroma, dark fruits, burned malts, light prunes, light whiskey.
Great taste, some smoke, peat, vanilla, whiskey, alcohol notable, dark fruits, fortified wine, some wood.
Medium thick body with good carbonation. A bit sticky on the palate.
Great ale.
Pours jet black with a thin mocha head. Aroma of chocolate, malt, peat, and roast. Taste follows, very peat forward. Interesting but Im not a peat guy.

rate #6300 but from notes (had late 2014). Fantastic brew, as expected. Thin but not thin...great smooth sipper without being too heavy or cloying, though it looks like motoe oil. wonderful whiskey and malt and cocoa nose. warming heat.

Bottle from sheffield tap. Pours like dark brown oil with a short lived tan head. Aroma is peaty smoky whisky, oaky wood and soy. Taste is sweet and spicy with alcohol, finishes with an ashy dry bitterness that makes you immediately want another sip. Thick and oily with subtle carbonation. Probably the best beer Ive ever tasted.

Bottle. Next to black in the glass, at least dark, dark brown, with a small, light beige head. The aroma is lightly boozy, with peat, chocolate, roasted malts, brown sugar and molasses. Its sweet and boozy in the flavor, peaty, with molasses, brown sugar and dark bitter chocolate. Its full-bodied and warming on the palate, with a nice carbonation. Lasting roasted, peated and a tad boozy finish. Sure nice this one. 150207

Bottle. Pours black with a small off-white head. Aroma of chocolate, malt, some alcohol, caramel and nuts. Flavor is sweet and malty with some chocolate, whisky and oak. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, alcohol, caramel, molasses, wood and whisky. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter with a long warm, roasted, woody, whisky and chocolate finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat

Bottle. Pours a murky deep molasses brown with a tan head that dissipates nearly completely. Aroma has a strong molasses and bitter dark grain note with a bit of soy and a some whiskey tones underlying. Flavor has lots of molasses and bitter dark grains, soy and roasted malts.
Bottle shared by Derek and Sarah - thanks! Dark deep reddish brown pour with a smaller head. Smoke and wood, soy. Rich. This is really good.

Bottle from Haskells, Minnetonka. Deep brown with a small tan head. Rather mellow nose. Some roasted malts, peat, dark chocolate. A bit of soy and oxidized forest fruits. Slight boozy heat.t Taste of dark chocolate. More peat. Pretty rich. Plenty of umami. Some salt. Ashy cranberry. Full body, viscous. Overall, very nice, but not a game changer.
Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Dark brown, small head. Peaty whisky aroma. Mid sweet with medium-full body and rounded mouthfeel. Molasses and sugar, peat and whisky. Low bitterness

Appearance- Thick dark black with a small brown head. Not long lasting with little to no lacing.
Aroma- dark chocolate, smokey peat,deep roasted malt.
Flavor- smokey, molasses, dark chocolate, vanilla, nice balance of sweet and smokey bitter.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2014 Bottle: Thanks, Kevin. Black hole black, total collapse of all nearby light. Oily, thick, viscous. Wow. Fine bubble, tan colored foam with a nice heft at the outset of the glass. Lots of blunted smokiness & peat in the aroma, no mistaking the Scotch barrels, here. Burnt wood, tobacco, mild char, worn leather, peated malt. Smells like roasted Scotch sans the harsh alcohol & fusel notes. Straight up liquid smoke with the first sip. Both meaty & peaty with heavy undercurrents of leather, spicy oak, charred tree bark, campfire smoke... Very rich, robust, & super smoky. Leafy tobacco & vibrant earthiness towards the finish with subtle hints of peppercorn, wood, leather, & of course, more smoke. Lightest touch of sweetness, but mostly pretty ashy & moderately bitter. Fans of smoked beers will love this. Very nice.

330 ml bottle into snifter; bottle #06105, bottled in 4/2013. Pours pitch black color with a small dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a thin lacing cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, vanilla, toast, toffee, dark bread, oak, whiskey, leather, light tobacco, light peat smoke, and roast/oak earthiness. Incredible aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt and oak barrel notes; with good strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, vanilla, toast, dark bread, toffee, oak, whiskey, leather, light tobacco, light peat smoke, and roast/oak earthiness. Light roasted bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, vanilla, toast, dark bread, toffee, oak, whiskey, leather, light peat smoke, and roast/oak earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity and balance of dark/roasted malt and oak barrel flavors; with a great roasted malt bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very smooth, creamy, and lightly slick/bready mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is well hidden with only a light warming present after the finish. Overall this is an incredible old ale! All around awesome complexity and balance of dark/roasted malt and oak barrel flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

August 4 2014. Bottled april 2013.
Pours black with a very small tan head. Aroma is peat, chocolate, oak, licorice, vanilla. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter chocolate, peat, light salty licorice. Finish is light bitter roasted, peat and a touch of alcohol. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation.

33 cl bottle. Bottle #3264. BBE 04/2016.
Pours black color with a small off-white head. Licorice and dark malts on the nose, dark chocolate, faint vanilla and some mild earthy notes. Lots of licorice on the flavor also, malts, oak notes, chocolate, faint coffee and caramel. Smooth bready palate, soft carbonation, lingering sweet finish. Very nice and refined.
4316

33 cl bottle @ tiong, BBE 04/2016
Aroma has sweet whisky tones, peat and smoky notes. Flavour has strong woody tones, islay whisky, peat and some licorice. Also hints of oat. The whisky is rather strong here and even stings a little.

330 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown, almost black colour without a head. Aroma of strong roasted malts, peat, saltiness and chocolate. Flavour of roastiness, strong salty licorice, biscuit, tart wooden notes, milk and subtle smoked notes. Full bodied and oily mouthfeel. Soft but maybe a tad too subtle, thin and easy.

330ml bottle from Systembolaget
Bottle #03264, BBE APR 2016 - Pours pitch black with a tiny brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, molasses, some notes of wood, whisky, oak and sherry. Taste is smooth and oily, heavy with whisky notes, oak and sherry. Finish is warming, smooth and sweetish with some roastiness and whisky notes. Pretty heavy and oily.

Bottle as part of an Ola Dubh vertical. Pours a very dark brown color. Nose has quite a bit of wood in there, with some nice roasting and scotch to it. Taste is very roasty with some scotch. Feels very smooth. Nice.

Bottle: &nbsp More roastiness, less ash and peat. &nbsp More iodine for sure. &nbsp Body seems to thin out a bit, but its not thin. &nbsp A little warming. &nbsp More scotch like than all the rest, soft peat lingers. &nbsp Still good. &nbsp Thanks Matt!
Very delicious black beer with distinct whiskey notes and light smoke. Its incredibly that it is 10.5%. - Dangerous
Bottle at Bobbys tasting. Pours black oil with tan head. Nose/taste of brownie, oak, whiskey, roast chocolate, molasses and wood. Medium body.
Bottle. Black pour with tan pour. Peat, smoke other barrel aromas. Chocolate, roasted, smoke, peat other barrel flavors.

A dark cola brown with little to no head. Smells of mollasses, venison, soy, cheese, chocolate, scotch. Taste is sweet chocolate, scotch alcohol notes, brown sugar, some hop bitter at the end, some roasted flavors and a little smokiness. Great complex beer, sweeter than I expected, mouthfeel is a little thin. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark brown with chestnut highlights, small off white head that disappears and decent lacing. Aroma is savory and peaty with smoke, mild roast and licorice. Taste is peaty, roasty and smokey with some tobacco and a malty sweetness along with some savoriness. Finishes dry with some roasty bitter. Mouthfeel is light/ medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Nice balanced whiskey flavors.

2013 bottle. Pours a deep, dark mahogany brown. Very little khaki head. Aroma is very peaty with molasses, smoke and a hint of licorice. Taste is the same with a tobacco roast and smoke and a sweetness that I can't quit identify, except for possibly the malt. Savory. A medium full mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black, with a very small brown head that fades in a flash. Aroma of peaty scotch, toffee, licorice, roast, and molasses. Taste is rich, but not too sweet, and full of roasty and peaty whisky flavor with some bitter dark chocolate and woody flavors as well. Full bodied, oily, smooth, almost no carbonation, and just a little tingly from the booze. Decadent; I love it. Bottle 02790

Bottle. Hearty, near black body with a low brown head. Heaps of peaty whiskey with equal measure of thick sweet malts, raisins and chocolate and wood. This would be a really fun series to do a vertical with. Really nice brew.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
After moving. Bottle number 6!! Bottled in April. 
Huge whiskey note on the nose. A little roasty. A little mossy musty note. 
Appearance is very dark brown. 
Taste is very balanced. Roasty chocolate notes. Big whiskey note. 

Palate is smooth. A little too much carbonation maybe. 

This is a really good beer but its almost too much. The whiskey works well with the porter since its a little lighter. Maybe not worth the money but pretty cool to check out if you get a chance.
Svart farve med beige skum. Lukt av røstet malt, frukt, kaffe, sjokolade og bek. Smak av røstet malt, whiskey frukt, kaffe, og bek. Vinøs. Melkebaren
Duft av bek, lakris og kaffe. Dyp sort farge. Lite skum, brun ring langs kant. God nydelig smak av kaffe, bek, lakris og en anelse mørk sjokolade.
330ml bottle (no. 5,249 of 20,000) at home - opaque very dark brown near black, no head, treacle toffee aroma, sweet, viscous, mild peaty sherryness, very sweet aftertaste
330ml bottle from Hippo Beers, shared. Almost black, no head. Treacle malt aroma. Smokey peaty whiskey flavour. Sweet whiskey aftertaste. Not for me.
Bottle Shared With Mr_H a datk beer with shsrp whisky Notes Quite Peaty some sweetness but a shsrp bitter finish lets this down

Poured from a April 2013 motor oil a touch of head.
Aroma is dark fruit soy molasses. Flavor is quite the same.as previous Ola Dubh but more carbonated. Still impressed.

Aroma is smoke chocolate dark fruits and some booze. Appearance is black like old engine oil with a small tan head. Palate is slightly viscous with good carbonation. This beer is best aged. This bottle has been sitting around for months and significantly better from when first tasted. Overall excellent.
sweet chocolate and tar aroma,black, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice soft harmonic finish.

Almost black, has a tight, light-brown head, medium duration. Heavy roasted aroma, old medicine, and wood. Flavor starts sweet and roasted, some smoky notes and nice crisp whisky. Creamy, dry texture.

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Dark red amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy nice aroma. Heavy bitter strange but nice flavor. Smoked, barrel; viníus. Long complex finish. Creamy palate. Wonderfull.
Had a glass from a bottle at a tasting at The Andersons. Still plenty of foam. Sweet toasty chocolate nose. Wow, fairly dry, fresh-ish, caramel, no whiskey flavor.

Bottle ought @ Systembolaget. Pours viscous blackish brown with a small dark mocha head that quickly dissipates without leaving much trace on the glass. Smell is malty with caramel, liquorice fudge, dark chocolate, vanilla fudge, peat, charred wood, raisins, alcohol, prunes, roasted malts, and smoldering hay. Taste is sweet, bitter and malty with roasted malts, smoke, charred wood, vanilla fudge, moist soil, minerals, peat, liquorice, alcohol, bitter chocolate, burnt raisins, prunes, burnt caramel and hay. Mouthfeel is round, roasted astringent, tiny boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is bitter with caramel, burnt raisins, bitter chocolate, charred wood, peat, whisky, hay, soil and alcohol. Solid stuff that pairs great with a piece of chocolate.

The aroma is pure heaven! Peat, roasted malts, dark fruit sweetness, cheese (nice), chocolate, and suggestions of molasses. Pours as black crows eye with a thin non-lasting espresso head and minimal lacing. Smoke, fruit sweetness, rich roasted malt, chocolate, with a strong peat finish and aftertaste. Bring on the Scotch! WHOA! Full body and moderate carbonation. Rich oily mouthfeel. Overall, this is an exceptional beer well worth the price and well worth buying again and again.

Pours opaque brown with a thin off white head. Nose is huge on dark fruits! Prunes. Flavor starts out strong with lots of sweet prunes. But finishes somewhat disappointing. Slightly smokey. Very sweet. Overall great beer.

330 ml bottle @ Cardinal. Black body with a small brown head. Nice, relatively mild aroma of black, roasted malt, peat, whisky and liquorice. Flavor is pretty much identical with aroma with some dry fruit in addition, moderate in bitterness. Fine body and pleasant aftertaste. A bit rustic in flavors, but rather mild at the same time, nothing is overdone. All in all a very nice one.
On draft. Aroma of whiskey and cocoa. Mouth feel is heavy, as if I was drinking a rich cupcake. Lots of whiskey flavor with undercurrents of raisin and molasses. Boozy as it warms. A winter warmer.

Very unique but Im not sure I would have another. The aroma was wood and whiskey. It had a very dark viscous color. The palate was not overly heavy as expected but smooth an oily. Carbonation was not high nor should it have been. This was a complex beer. It was dry and woody with earth and whiskey tones. Smokey flavors were also very present. There was a dry bitterness which completed the oak. It had some sweetness but not overly so. Im interested in trying the other versions to see how different they are.
Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget. Black with beige head. Heavy tar and salmiak roasted malt aroma, cloying salty and smokey whiskey. Full bodied, soft carbonation. Semi dry, medium salty bitterness.
12oz pours a dark black with a small tan head. Peat oak and chocolate aroma. Taste is the same.

Gorgeous restrained dark chocolate and treacle nose. Full bodied but not sappy. Black with a deep brown tan whispy head. Complex earthy chocolaty body which is full but in no way sappy and unravels and caresses the mouth before making contact with a smokiness and the strong whisky barrel element. Beautiful, restrained and still pretty young. Will love to see how it all integrates in the coming years.
Pours black into a snifter. Mocha head with good retention recedes to coat surface. Molasses, caramel and smoke aromas. Thick with peat and molasses front to back. Warming whiskey finish.

Dark brown pour with a tan head. The aroma has some strong peat, smoke and toffee notes. The flavor is very similar. I get a lo tot smoke and peat notes as well as some chocolate and toffee. There is a bit of sweetness but what really stands out are the Scotch-aged notes. Fairly boozy. Medium to thick mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Tastes like the chocolate made with Laphroaig that you get at Dude Sweet Chocolate in Dallas. Very nice.
Bottle at Sheffield Tap. Black, oily looking, no head. Boozy, chocolate roast, tasty. Boozy aroma, with sherry notes, fruity. Pretty good sipping beer.

Bottled. Pours dark, deep brown with a medium sized, lacing tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, molasses, wood, smoked notes, earthy hops and alcohol. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and with bitter notes. Medium to full bodied, oily carb. and soft carb. An excellent brew.
Pours a dark brown body with almost no head. Rich of bread tones and other interesting flavours.
Bottle at Craigs tasting. Sweet whisky and chocolate nose, chocolate and liquorice, rich.

Bottle at Craigs. Pours jet black with a tan head and lacing. Aromas of fruitcake and chocolate. Taste has an earthy quality, and subtle whisky notes. Of the three barrel-aged we had this was by far the best. Beautiful balance between the beer and the whisky. Lovely.

330, capped. Thanks j and a! Pours a murky ebony with a scant tan ring. Big oily smoky peaty and mildly iodiney nose. The promised soy and molasses are there as well. Creamy medium body with soft carb. Oily, peaty, molassesy and iodine-rich mid palate. Long toasty molasses finish.

Small tan head dark pour mild carbonation and aromas smoked noted whiskey the oak vanilla note molasses dark fruit coffee rich chocolate the flavours a dryness gritty cocoa dark chocolate molasses rich coffee medium bitter dark fruit plums a salty note sweet caramel oak and whiskey a vanilla taste smooth the finish wonderful ale good body best tastes rich malts dry note oak influence hops lasting bitter sweet taste cracking ale

The biggest thing about this beer is just how subtle and balanced the beer is. Yes you can taste the whisky but its a passing note, you can taste the beer that is the basis of the bottle. Its sweet its deep its lovely.

bottle at home ... deep black ... thin tan lacing ... soft dark roast ... dark chocolate malts ... luxurious deep rich chocolate ... dark malts... chewy malts ... sweet malts ... dark roast ... little over whisky ... nice

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Black colour with a small tan head.
Aroma: Roasted malt, caramel, peat, chocolate, alcohol.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Smokey, chocolate, whiskey, caramel.

DØE tasting, Århus, Dk.
Bottle, 201113.
Black with beige head. Aroma of roasted malt. Flavor with chocolate, alcohol and caramel

Pours a deep burnt umber with a trace of khaki foam. The nose is spicy whisky soaked wood, chocolate syrup, herbal cola and earthy toffee and leather. The palate follows the nose with ripe dark fruit mingling with dark chocolate roast, really complex spicy booze and some soft coconut roundness lingers with the sweet finish.

Tap at the birch. Pours opaque black, small brown head, some lacing. Aroma is roasty, chocolate, peat, smoke, coffee. Flavor is the same, quite peaty, but the stout flavors comes through as well. Light sweet, light plus bitter. Full body, creamy mouthfeel. Nice balance.
Aroma of dark dried fruits, chocolate, whiskey, wood, vanilla. The flavour is very much the same. Very well balanced.

Bottle from Eileen. Poured an oily pitch black body with a smaller creamy deep beige head. Aroma sweet smoke, sherry, wood, dark berries, dark molasses and soy sauce. Full bodied with average carbonation and some heat. Flavor is smoke, sherry, cask, soy, black olives, bad dark chocolate. Interesting sipper.
UPDATED: DEC 13, 2013 On tap at Mekong, pours black with low head, aroma is roasted sweet bourbon malt. Taste is very smooth roast with a nice whiskey finish.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a tiny tan head that leaves no lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, peat, liquorice, chocolate, and a little vanilla  with a bitter and peaty finish.
Bottle @ Odense Beer & Ball Saturday - Cardiff vs. Arsenal. Dark brown body with a tiny offwhite head. Tar, asphalt, wood, smoke, whisky notes. Bitter end.

Bottle @ Beer & Ball Saturday, Odense. 13,000th Tasting. Pours black with bubbles on top. Molasses, dark fruit, vague roast and a vinous complex note. Smoke and wood. Woody flavor, some roast , mild peat, soy and mollases. Smooth and oily. Fine sipper.

Odense Beer & Ball Saturday - Viborg - Sønderjysk E. Black with a small tan head. Aroma of licorice and caramel, with some peated smoke. Sweet dark malt flavour of licorice with peated smoke and some ashy notes

33cl, Bottle N°07420, new exclusive Scottish brew Anno 2013, from Voldby Købmandsgaard Hammel, complex sweet Porter, roasted/woody and slightly malty/spicy, yet not too heavy, very balanced, hazy, nearly no head, very good brew, yet expensive!

Bottle @ døe meeting. Pitch black, no head or lacing. Aroma, roasted malts, chocolate, smoke, alcohol, dark fruits, wood/oaky, .Taste, roasted malts, chocolate, dark fruits, whiskey, smoke, wood. Oily mouth feel. Roasted malt, smoky aftertaste. Nice warming feeling.

Bottle.
Pours black with a chocolate Brown head.
Heavy cocolatey brew, some coffee stout like, but some vinousity remides that it is an old ale. Good body but slightly too much peat.

Bottle from SB cons 2013-11-22 Göteborg
AR: coffey, bitter dark chocolate, tar, tobaco, peatiness from a Islay whiskey? checked and it was Highland Park;)
AP: soot black, wee traces of dark brown head
F: soft wee bubbly carbonation, dark bitter high cacao %ish, heat from the alcholic level - well hidden, thai coffey pastilles, wee peatiness, full bodied, wee sea salt, tar, tobaco, wee sugary sence Heather: ginger spiceinss sense,

Bottle @ DØE Århus S meeting. Pours very brown with a small brown head, leaving some nice lacings. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, oak, light earthy, chocolate, little whisky. Flavor is sweet malts, caramel, wood, oak, dark chocolate, tartness, whisky. Medium body, soft nearly flat carbonation, alcohol very well hidden. 201113

(bottle 20/11-2013) Low light brown head, dark brown almost black color, roasted slightly alcohol aroma, smoked slightly dry wood taste, smooth taste. BB date apr 2016, bottle #07433, bottled apr 2013.

Bottle, 14C. Black with a small tan head that doesnt last. Aroma of blackstrap, PX sherry, chocolate, seaweed, chestnuts, hazelnuts, blackberries. You can obviously _believe_ whisky but it doesnt stick out as a separate element (which is good in my book). Oily, full bodied. Whisky is far more obvious in the mouth. Sweet with dark berries, molasses, PX sherry, earthy nuts. A bit of peat and/or seaweed. Still sweetish at the end, but theres a surprising lightening there, so I guess it dries out discreetly. They keep cranking variants out and I keep liking them.
Bottle. Black with tan head. Meaty aroma, some chocolate and whisky. Taste is full on whiskey, like someones plopped a shot in my beer, some chocolate. A bit thin and quick to finish. Decent

Bottle thanks to Josh. It pours cloudy dark brown with a medium beige head. The nose is woody, earth, wood, medicinal notes, vanilla, marshmallow and nougat. The taste is wood, soft roast, toast, vinous, jam, plum, earth, cocoa, molasses, oily and whisky. Medium+ body, moderate carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Smooth, well-balanced and pretty tasty. Another winner from Harviestoun.

Very dark brown, almost no head. Aroma of smoke, dark fruits, earth, tobacco, cocoa, wood. Not sweet at all. Medium bitterness and some whiskey smokiness and alcohol heat. Oily texture which is nice but the body is way too light and theres just a little bit too much carbonation.

Bottle at Bruces. Dark brown pour with a small khaki head. Nose is dry cocoa powder, moderate peat, earthiness, wood and some light spice. The peat is never too over the top in this. Balance is very good. Light medicinal notes in the taste, peat more prevalent, dry and earthy, smoked and wet wood, leafy. Not my type of beer but I can see the appeal and it is done very well

Bottle shared at Bruces in London - many thanks to Josh for getting this one. Pours clear, dark red-brown with a bubbly beige head. The nose holds dry cocoa, hints of vanilla, a bit of burnt wood. Medium sweet flavor with rich peat, dry cocoa, good earth, some dried fruits. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Finishes with decent peat smoke, some ash, dry chocolate, burnt toast. Delicious and well balanced.

From 12oz bottle, comparing to 30yo Old Dubh. 

Pitch black poor with minor head. Aroma is a bit stronger than with the 30yo. Pleasant mocha-coffee-chocolate flavor. But more of a bite than the 30yo, which I liked. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Tim. Also with 30 yr old as well. Smells better than the 30. 50 degrees. Black no head. Hot with alcohol but smooth. Enjoyable beer but not sure its worth whatever it cost

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Near-black body, not entirely opaque. Minimal head, if any. 

Smokey (but not too much), barrel is prominent but still in balance, right at the limit of my peat & smoke threshold. Solid.

THIS is my type of beer! 
Almoust black beer with less than one finger high beige head. 
Nose: Single malt whisky, pine, roasted malt, leather, dark syrup, nuts, brown sugar, coffee and dark chocolate. 
Taste: Sweet malt, pine, tobacco, dark bread, roasted malt, caramel, date, honey, and dark chocolate. The alcohol is hidden perfectly! 
Full body with almoust no carbonation. Very complex. 
Pure love!

Bottle shared at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Black-colored with a light brown head. Whiskey-ish aroma, woody, malty, roasty, a bit ashy, with some dark chocolate and nutty notes, a bit alcoholic. Sweetish roasty flavor, ashy, with whiskey, burnt wood, a bit of dark chocolate and a slightly alcoholic finish. Full-bodied.

Bottle shared at a tasting at the Dancing Camel Pub Florentin. Pours black with a beige head, aroma is smoked with chocolate, burnt wood, coffee, butterscotch, some peaty notes, flavor of charcoals, chocolate, coffee, brandy, scotch, cigars, full bodied, big one

Sample from bottle at the Cardinal stand at Nærbø, Ølfestivalen 2013. Black with a light brown rim. Whiskey notes and roasted tones on the nose. Full bodied and pungent beer that drinks smoothly. Sweet and malty flavors with whiskey barrel notes and plenty of roasted dark fruits.

Bottled, bbe. apr 2016. Bottle nr 02243. Almost black color, brown thin head. Intense woody aroma, dark fruits, whiskey, tar, dark chocolate notes. Sticky, very intense aroma. Flavor is as intense as the aroma, whiskey, smoke, sweetness, wood, tobacco, smoke, roasted malt... Very complex. The finish is long with ash, alcohol burn / warmth and smoke lingering. The barrel notes is taking over too much, hiding the characteristics of the beer. Still highly enjoyable due to its complexity. A slow sipper.

From notes: Poured a deep, opaque black, with a 1-finger dark tan head and moderate bubbling along the wall of the glass. Aroma is woody with a nice roasty note, and maybe a touch of leather as well. Full body with a pleasant thickness. Long finish with a touch of booziness that I would expect to mellow with aging. Nice woody flavor with a light note of caramel, and a pleasant amount of char from the barrel and some leathery notes as well. Very good now, and I would expect it to become better with age.

From bottle at Nærbøfestivalen 13. Pours thick and oily black, no head. Aroma is weak peat, liquorice and light roasty. Taste is sweet,thick oily liquorice, weak roasted malts and coffee, the peat shines thru at the light dry and bitter end. Very good

11.16 ounce bottle, bottle #00678, April 13. Served in a snifter, the beer pours dark brown/black with a half inch tan head. Head retention and lacing are both good. The brew smells like Scotch whisky, peat, dark fruit, dark chocolate, vanilla, and some tobacco. It tastes like roasted malt, Scotch Whisky, peat, vanilla, dark fruit, wood chocolate and smoke. Mouthfeel/body is medium/full, its slick and smooth with low/moderate carbonation. I think this is a pretty tasty brew, I liked it. Its pricey at $15.99 a bottle, but if you like Scotch Whisky barrel aged brews then you should definitely pick this one up. That and pretty much any Ola Dubh beer will be a good one!

Black colour with a creamy head. Aroma of malt, wood, tar and whisky with a weak hint of chocolate. A round, smooth taste of dark chocolate and malt with a distinct streak of whisky and wood. Full, slightly oily feel and a warming touch of alcohol. Also a slight taste and aroma of molasses and some sweet caramel.

On tap @ Tørst, New York. Pours black with a creamy finger thick mocha head. Aroma is appealing burned malts with sea side notes of oak and peat, as well as leather, molasses, vanilla and chocolate. Body is tremendously velvety full and creamy without carbonation. Flavour is sweet burned malts with lots of chocolate, lactose and a sea side twist, as well as dark fruits with raisins and prunes. Sweet fruity finish with nice notes of chocolate.
Bottle. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is licorice, coffee, oak, roasted malt. Flavour is licorice, coffee, oak, malt, hop, alcohol, chocolate. full body. Very nice beer.

Pours dark with no to low off white head
Aromas has distinct smoked whisky cask, peated malts, roasted malts, tar, coffee
Taste has whisky cask, peated malts, smoke, german sausage
Palate is well balanced with a nice malty backbone

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Systembolaget. Sweet malty, chocolate, coffe, vanilla. Similar taste with a noticeable bourboun touch. Also a bit boozy.
Black with nice creama.Aroma roasted malt, mocha, Taste rich and sweet mocha, roasted malt. Full body, text smooth, carb low, finish bittersweet.

Heavy aroma of raisins, oak and tar. A little sweetness, very light taste anyway. Very good taste of oak with a long and good taste of dark, strong coffee. I really liked the aftertaste. Surprisingly easy to drink for being so strong. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Svart öl med mörk brunt skum. Doft: Kaffe godis, rågbröd, mörk mjölkchoklad, vanilj, lätt bränd marmelad, körsbärs pralin, wiskey. Smak: Samma som doft fast + lite lakrits och mjukare och rundare.

Bottle. Aroma has notes of whiskey, caramel, vanilla, porto, dark dried fruits, sherry, smoke and oak, molasses, dark chocolate, yeast, roasted malts and soy. Very complex to say the least! Very dark brown that sits black as night in the glass. Small light tan head that mostly diminished and left no lace. Flavor is very sweet and bitter. Palate is full bodied and watery soft. Overall a very intense brew that really feels and smells like its been aged for a century. Very complex and a pleasure to sip.

12 oz. bottle from Tasty Beverage Company, Raleigh, NC. Dark brown to almost black pour with a slight tan head. Aroma of smoked meats, soy, Earth, wood, and faint floral hops. Taste is of bitter espresso, smoke, damp oak, cocoa, and surprisingly light whiskey. The whiskey, however, lingers on the palate and there is a gentle warmth from the alcohol. Sherry-like rich mouthfeel. This is a very interesting, complex beer.
High level of barrel aging in this one. Aroma is brimful of sugars, chocolate and licorice, notes of wood and dark fruits. Silky smooth mouth and and a complex finish.

Pours black with no head. Aroma is tar, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, muscovado sugar. Taste is chocolate, vanilla, tar, dark red berries, coffee. Very well balanced and really really good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Small brown head. Opaque black body. Earthy chocolatey roasty
aroma with whisky and toffee notes. Sweet-dryish earthy roasty
toffee taste with chocolatey spicy notes. Fullish body. Mild,
soft, smooth, rounded mouthfeel with slight heat. Dryish earthy
smoky whisky taste with toffee notes. Perfectly balanced and
harmonic, but perhaps a little more earthy and raw than the other
Ola Dubhs. Lacking that lovely bitter-sweet edge running through
it. Still an outstanding beer by any standards. (0.33l bottle,
from Fish & Beer, Copenhagen.)

12 ounce bottle from Belmont Station. Pours a murky dark mahogany color with a small brown head. A light but robust nose of wood, char, smoke, sweet malt profile. A really good subtle and complex brew: wood, scotch, peat, bitter roast, chocolate, vanilla, some creamy mocha. Age. This tastes old. Done perfectly as usual. These series of beers are great.
Bottle at Yesprs - Thanks. Clear dark brown - offwhite head. Oiley, fruity, smokey, high malty, sweet notes, light oxidation, dried fruits, ok.

Aroma: Smelling of sweet molasses, dried dates, cold coffee and oak.Appearance: A dark black colored beer. A brown head with some lacing and good curtains.Taste: Tasting sweet dark bread, bitter coffee, dark cocoa and burned oak.Palate: Low carbonation, a soft and oily texture. A big body with a somewhat dry finish.Overall: Very sweet, very potent. Overwhelmingly dark.Note: Bottle 330 ml. (Vintage 1991) Reviewed 2013-09-03.

Bottle @ yespr. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty woody whisky caramel and chocolate aroma. Roasted malty woody whisky and weak smoky chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty woody smoky whisky and chocolate finish.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2013 330ml bottle, pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of malt, smoke, dark chocolate, coffee and vanilla. Taste is similar and very complex, malt, smoke, dark cholate, coffee, vanilla, liquorice and whiskey. Nearly flat carbonation, full bodied with a slightly creamy texture, smooth and well balanced. An excellent beer.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with small light tan head. Aroma of chocolate, licorice, port wine, wood, peat, ash and light sweet alcohol. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of port wine, wood, peat, licorice and ash. Medium bodied with low to medium carbonation. Really quite nice.
Bottle 3064, bought at Systembolaget. Black with a small tan head. Aroma and taste of light roasted malt, chocolate, wood and whisky. Quite sweet with a long finish. A nice perfect to sip.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2015 (Bottle). 737414. Sweet scent of chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt, molasses and soya. The flavor has a distinct hint of vanilla with flavors of roasted malt, raisins, dried fruit, peat and whiskey. A bit too much caramel and vanilla flavor for my taste! -- (Bottle, 2013). After around one and a half years in bottle the flavors has matured and softened and become more balanced. I like the beer better now than when it was fresh bottled. Nice sweet flavors of roasted malt, raisins  and molasses, also notes of smoke and peat and the vanilla flavor is damped.

Flaska från SB. Kolsvart, lågt skum. Alkoholvärme, söt doft av karamelliserat socker, choklad, vanilj, fat, whisky. Sammetslen, komplex, söt, fat, vanilj, chokladkola, hårdrostad, russin. Superdessertöl.

Svart med beige skum.  
Sjokolade og noe gress, smaker også noe sjokolade. 
Medium bitterhet, lite kullsyre

Bottle, bought @ YNWA Beershop, Kolding.
Pours deep black with a medium, creamy, beige head. Aroma is very lovely, roasted, dark chocolate, oak, vanilla, smoke, light peity. Lovely creamy and very full mouthfeel. Flavour is elegant, dark chocolate, light roasted, nutty, lots of whiskey smoke, oak. Very bitter malty finish with quite some warming viniousness. Really pleasant (like all the other Dubhs).

Bottle 3203 out of 20 000. Doesnt say anything about being a RIS but certainly smells like that. Very exclusive looking. Not too intrusive like sometimes IPAs can be when the bottle has just been opened. But when dipping the nose in it you can feel the rich, smoky aroma of quality scotch. Lovely rich intimate taste and aroma. Have to say its elegant and a bit different from a lot of other overpowering imperial stouts. Luxurious! Cant have it every day but want it again and would make a lovely present.

Where and how:  The Birch Norfolk
Aroma rich, vinous, alcoholic, some dryness on top (despite being 1991 vintage) Licorice, vanilla dark malts. Very good.8+
 Appearance:
Top: minimal light top.
Base: dark brownish-black, almost still.
Palate :  medium plus bodied, lower carbonation , long finish.
Taste: smoky , with pit , chocolate, port.
 Other notes  refined, splendid superb brew.
Poured from tap. Thick dark brown color, slight tan lacing. Licorice and alcohol smell, very faint malt. Sweet, smokey, syrupy malt flavor.
Bottled. Almost black coloured. Dense light brown head. ARoma: Herbs, sweetness, caramel, roast. Flavour: Spice, liqourice, fruits, sweetness, roast, caramel. medium bdoied. Ends roasted bitter.

Bottle at yespr.
Dark brown coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet and light roasted aroma of caramel, dark chocolate, soy sauce and whisky.
Sweet and light roasted flavour of caramel, dark chocolate, earth and whisky.
Roasted finish.
Bottled. A black beer with a tan head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt and alcohol.the flavor is sweet with notes iodine, roasted malt and straw, leading to roasted malt.

pitch dark, small light brown head.
aroma is roasted malts, booze, mild hops.flavor is roasted malts, faint smoke ,wood, whiskey, supernice not so heavy stoutish flavor, smoke, wood and booze work very well together.

33 cl bottle. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma is dense chocolate and smooth caramelish to vanilla. Thick malty, light tarish, dense dark chocolate. Bitter and lingering roasted malty finish.
Tap at Tørst. Pours a thick black with a big offwhite head. Smells strongly of Highland. Taste is a big chocolate malt, with some sea salt, and a big boozy whisky finish.

Draught from Tørst. Pours deep black with big dense tan head. Aroma is soy, sherry, toffee, lightly smokey. Taste had distinct Scotch flavor though well balanced, cherries, smoke, charcoal,dark chocolate. Feel is creamy and lively but also the roast sits heavy. Light cooling astringency and charred wood. Really big but balances with enough complexity to keep it interesting.

Bottle #01212. Pours like motor oil with just a bit of ruby sunlight passing through the edges. No head whatsoever. Aroma of dark rich chocolate, peat, booze, smoke, leather, tobacco. Smells pretty intense. Flavor is big smokey peat and some sweet dark chocolate. Slight dry oak, salty soy sauce, and a lingering scotch on the palate. A bit more harsh than the 16 I had. Thick but with a bit of prickly carbonation. Was hoping for a little more thickness but overall an interesting sipper.

Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate chocolate, smoke, peat, tobacco, and light molasses. It pours a dark brown with no transparency and a small khaki head that quickly fades to a thin film. The flavor starts with moderate chocolate and vanilla. The finish has light-moderate roast, smoke, and a touch of tobacco. Its medium-full bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel.

Bottle # 01483 and served in my Iechyd Da snifter: Pours a nearly black colour with a fading frothy beige head and minimal lace but some oily tears. The aroma is a symphony of smoke, oak, roast, char, leather, pipe tobacco, bakers chocolate, star anise and peaty earthiness. The taste supports the nose completely with lush malty overtones, fantastic barrel added complexity, smoke and ash, chocolate and sweet pipe tobacco. Hint of nutty and dark fruit appears as well. The mouth feel is slick and lush, warming of course but still remains shocking drinkable. This is a world class beer and a perfect match with almost any rich and heavy Maduro cigar. Get ya some before they are gone.

Bottle 330ml.Clear dark black - red brown colour with a small, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly to fully diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, peat, dark malt, dark roasted, light alcohol. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light heavy bitter with a long duration, peated, dark roasted, coal. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130629]

330 ml bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 10.5%. Pitch black colour, moderate tan head. The aroma has moderately roasty and oaky notes (more sherry than whisky), hints of soy sauce, liquorice and blackstrap syrup. The flavour is not to sweet, roasty with coffee and liquorice notes, distinct oaky notes, you get an idea that this beer has been matured in a whisky barrel, hints of sherry again. Just a hint of peat smoke. Warming mouthfeel. Very good..

Bottle. Number 03183 from April 2013. Black pour with a short, tan ring of foam on the surface. Aroma is soft soy, treacle, light peat and bittersweet chocolate. Taste is smoky wood, peat, molasses, hints of soy sauce, bittersweet chocolate and oak notes. Body is medium with a light carbonation and mild warmth. Ends with more smoky notes, oak, light peat, molasses and sea salt with hints of booze and chocolate.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Almost black with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, wood and whisky. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter finish. Smooth. 290613

Bottle. Very dark brown with tiny beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and caramel. Flavour is roasted malts chocolate, coffee, medium sweet, little liquorice, hop, little peat, whiskey, wood and medium bitter.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Small head with short duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, chocolate, coffee, wood, molasses, caramel and hops.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2013 Bottle. Pours black with a thin khaki head. Aroma is peat, roasted malt, soy sauce and a touch of chocolate. Taste is very boozy. Scotch is prominent and some sweetness on the finish. Mouthfeel is a touch light for the style and has a strong carb. Pretty unique. The scotch is really a nice touch. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2015 Bottle #1439. Pours black with very little head that collects at the edges and grabs the glass well. Nice complex aroma of soy, smoke, earthy hops, vanilla, roasted malt and light whiskey. Taste is moderately sweet with lots of soy, whiskey barrel notes, and smoke. Spicy and earthy hop kick in the finish. Well balanced beer. Thin to medium body, oily slick mouthfeel. Overall, its really good stuff. A little thin but goes down so easy for the high abv.  Re-rate 10/1/15 - 2 year old bottle.  Still good but not as good.  Mostly whiskey and smoke now.  Thin body but goes down easy.

From a 33 cl bottle shared at home.  Bottle number 02771.  Pours a dark cola brown with a thin tan head,.  Aroma of leather.  Flavors of licorice, dark fruits and some smoky notes from the whisky cask.  Very tasty.

Bottle at home courtesy of Ewan at harviestoun, cheers sir!
Dark coffee with tan head. Fairly sweet nose, caramel, sherry, lactose, camp coffee, on swirling some meaty umami and iodine. Thick, mouthfilling with gentle carbonation and sweet red berries up front followed by a cornucopia of flavour. Dry toasty malt, astringent wood, meaty booze sweet vanilla, coconut appears on nose, dark cocoa, latte, both sweet and savoury, iodine whisky, dry woody notes, rich caramel. The booze very well hidden but creeps up on you with a knockout blow. Long rich dry finish. Fab
